tweet:
Happy #MothersDay to all! 

Even if you can’t be with your mom today, make sure to call and say thank you. Grateful for the chance to chat with my mom this morning — 93 years old and going strong!

Today is #AhmaudArbery's birthday. He should be celebrating like every other 26 year old would.
 
Instead, Ahmaud is dead at the hands of the same racism that for generations has robbed countless black Americans of countless birthdays.
 
We demand #JusticeForAhmaud.
Listening to Vera Lynn singing “we’ll meet again some sunny day.” There will be sunny days again.

Even in normal times, teachers have challenging jobs – and these are not normal times. To teachers across VA-11, a grateful community thanks you for your passion, your patience, and your unfailing optimism.
 
Happy #TeacherAppreciationWeek!

The Justice Department dropped its case against Gen Michael Flynn despite the fact that he plead guilty. Atty Gen Barr has besmirched the rule of law and revealed himself to be nothing but an obsequious toady to a lawless President. 

A day of shame in for justice in America.

Michael Flynn betrayed the oaths he took as a military officer and a public servant. We know this because he pled guilty to it. Twice. 

He is not a patriot. He is a criminal. And now he walks free.

Is this what you mean by “tough on crime,” @realDonaldTrump?

Trump rewards a partisan donor by installing him at #USPS. The Postal Service is in crisis and needs real leadership and someone with knowledge of the issues. 

This crony doesn’t cut it. https://t.co/V3mGOIcnRW
Proud to receive an A on @CDACN’s latest legislative report card. Children and families need support now more than ever, and I will fight to make sure they have it. https://t.co/5Lw3NMRTso

Nurses have always deserved our thanks. But now they’re on the frontlines of the fight against COVID-19, and our thanks are not enough. 

We owe them the equipment and support they need to protect their lives as they save ours. 

Signed, the son of a nurse.

#NationalNursesDay

We know how aggressively the #coronavirus can hit crowded living facilities. Nursing homes, college dorms, prisons, etc. 

Why would immigrant detention facilities be any different? 

We cannot forget our shared humanity. #ICE detainees must be released -- now.

Our death toll reaches an all time high every single day.

Do your job, @realDonaldTrump. Or get out of the way. https://t.co/UGxwU7kHN9

Even through a devastating pandemic, our federal workforce continues to serve our nation — delivering mail, providing healthcare, protecting our food supply, researching cures. 

We thank them always, and particularly now. #PublicServiceRecognitionWeek #PSRW

1,000+ American deaths have been announced every day for 33 consecutive days. 70,000 will be dead by tomorrow. 

1.1 million sick, and 30 million out of work.

If you're hearing that nothing you've done has been good enough, it's because nothing you've done has been good enough. https://t.co/2l6k3Es95G

The University of Washington's model doubles the number of projected deaths attributed to #coronavirus, largely because of premature reopening of businesses in states that are relaxing stay-at-home guidance. 

@realDonaldTrump's recklessness is costing lives.

So saddened to learn of the passing of Vienna’s George Lovelace. George served 14 years on the Town Council and in 1996 was elected as the first African American from NOVA to the Virginia House of Delegates. A quiet trailblazer. Condolences to his dear wife Donalda.

The Postal Service needs emergency aid, @realDonaldTrump.

It does not need business advice from the man who bankrupted a casino. https://t.co/wPh10jSXER

Trump thinks ingesting chemical disinfectants might help kill the #COVID19 virus. 

His degenerating resort to quackery (see sunlight, and malaria medicines) is dangerously unbalanced, and Republican defense of the very stable genius is increasingly untenable.
Ramadan Mubarak to all those who observe the holy month. May you and your family have a wonderful Ramadan filled with peace and blessings. Happy holidays. https://t.co/sELPnxfq8v

We've got to:

1. Get help to the small businesses who need it -- not the big guys who want it.
2. Provide relief to struggling state and local governments.
3. #SaveThePostOffice and its 600,000 employees.

That's what I'm fighting for. https://t.co/MGTcSoZWtC

Thank you to @GovernorVA, @GovLarryHogan, and @MayorBowser for joining our fight for telework for federal employees. We need a mandate from this Administration for both feds and contractors. https://t.co/oYGhglPOoB
Kicking off our @MeriTalk virtual town hall on federal employee protections, IT modernization, and the federal government’s response to COVID-19. https://t.co/JivCIS8OHX

Mitch McConnell is the grim reaper of legislation, an independent judiciary, and now of state and local governments. His callousness to our states, counties and cities, who are desperately struggling, give social Darwinism a bad name. 

Shame on grim reaper McConnell. Shame.

Today is the 50th Anniversary of #EarthDay.

We've only got one Earth. It's on all of us to make sure we protect her. https://t.co/rs1uizr7sm

https://t.co/dh65MlDZpt

https://t.co/hEFAIW7N9n
Trump’s coronavirus plan is to distract and deflect responsibility for his failure by launching another xenophobic attack on immigrants. It’s disgusting, shameful and will cost lives.

While this bill is improved and provides more funding for the Paycheck Protection Program, I have a clear message for Treasury and the Banks. These funds are to help small businesses survive – it’s not a reward program for your friends with the biggest bank account. 

DO BETTER.
Had a productive conference call with @AFGENational and hearing from federal employees this afternoon. It is clear that they need better protection and enhanced guidance through COVID-19.

https://t.co/2wVMVi5vPs

While the country is in deep pain Trump exploits the pandemic to implement his reactionary policies on immigration, EPA regulations, federal employee rights, postal service dismantlement and Tax cuts for the rich.

OPM's guidance on "reopening" is no guidance at all. It outsources decision-making to individual managers and washes its own hands of responsibility. 

Federal employees are not guinea pigs.

https://t.co/dcYxaOLhHr.

No explanation from the Census Bureau or White House.

I support PPP but we need to ensure it works for all businesses. Too many were left out of the lending process. Congress must also provide states/localities funding and flexibility. They are the safety net in America and that net is being torn asunder by a revenue collapse.

Yesterday was a milestone: 2,494 #COVID19 deaths. The all time high. 

And Trump wants to accelerate reopening the economy. 

Dismantling social distancing and reopening commerce prematurely risks lives. Listen to science, @realDonaldTrump. Not your Mar-a-Lago friends.
Hosting a call with NoVa local elected officials to hear their concerns about how Congress can help state and local governments respond to the COVID crisis.

#USPS is looking at a 50% drop in mail volume by June. That's just catastrophic.

This is so much bigger than your strange obsession with Jeff Bezos, @realDonaldTrump. Raising rates on Amazon will not #SaveThePostOffice. https://t.co/IEpY4sB2wo
Great. Now do the #USPostalService. https://t.co/jVQLD2Aw2b

Maybe we are too hard on POTUS. We should be glad we didn’t all get gift cards to Trump Hotel instead of direct payments. 

https://t.co/PheYq0uQ6e

Stimulus checks will now be delayed several days. Why? Because @realDonaldTrump wants to take credit for them.

He’s feeding his fragile ego at your expense. 

It’s shameless and shameful. https://t.co/R7wQxweepq

The #USPostalService is dangerously close to insolvency.

We are barreling toward a catastrophic collapse if we don’t take action.

https://t.co/JxbeY1uYd1

We are in a public health crisis and these conditions are abhorrent. We all share a common humanity and these people must be released.

https://t.co/ZAk4zMoBZI

Your daily reminder that the #USPostalService is on life support, and @realDonaldTrump is threatening to veto any #COVID19 legislation that includes funding to save it. 

#SaveUSPS #SaveThePostOffice 

https://t.co/inyFmUMbr2 https://t.co/0DcFr4sZdi

I ask again:

Why are you refusing to sign #COVIDー19 response legislation if it includes funds to #SaveThePostOffice? https://t.co/K6wykIDlOm

Turn the TV off.
 
And then save the #USPostalService. https://t.co/sKc1tV59L3

The #USPostalService needs $25 billion to stay afloat. 

That's less than the airlines are getting, and they've turned record profits in the last few years.

That is unconscionable. We have to #SaveTheUSPS. https://t.co/bk7k3EKYOd
Getting ready to join @AliciaMenendez on @MSNBC to discuss our fight to #SaveTheUSPS.⬇️ https://t.co/7aAd367VDZ

.@RepMaloney and I had a plan to #SaveTheUSPS:

-$25 billion in emergency funds 
-Eliminate current debt
-Provide flexibility to meet crisis conditions

It was in the @HouseDemocrats stimulus proposal. We were making progress. 

Trump threatened to sink any bill that included it.

Every single one of us will feel the impact if the #USPostalService disappears, @realDonaldTrump. 

The American people want to #SaveTheUSPS. Whether we can is up to you. https://t.co/0UQyiGlg2F
Happy Easter!
Why are you refusing to sign #COVIDー19 response legislation if it includes funds to #SaveThePostOffice? https://t.co/7d57W0jAZA

“Yet because the Postal Service technically operates under the executive branch, and President Donald Trump has displayed a bizarre hostility to it since taking office, it seems likely that the agency will receive some pushback.”

#SaveThePostOffice 

https://t.co/iTjrETTaYy

The Postal Service had 600,000 employees last year. They provide an essential service to every household and every business in America, every day.

We can't take them for granted. We've got to #SaveThePostOffice.

I spoke with the Postmaster General again today. She could not have been more clear: 

The Postal Service will collapse without urgent intervention, and it will happen soon.

We’ve pleaded with the White House to help. @realDonaldTrump personally directed his staff not to do so. https://t.co/5wPQvbA951
Getting ready for our member briefing with the Postmaster General of the @USPS. Congress must take immediate action to save the Postal Service. https://t.co/IulnmqXZRQ

Chag Sameach to all celebrating #Passover tonight.

IG Glenn Fine's firing as head of the Pandemic Response Accountability Committee is an outrage. We will not tolerate such a flagrant abuse of authority.

We just released our urgent legislative response. It must be included in the next #COVID19 package. 

https://t.co/5gNVKdUcXS https://t.co/CiIKDLfef6

This has never been about voter fraud. It’s always been about voter suppression. https://t.co/Ux5aK1006p

Tonight, Donald Trump was asked why he refused to fund USPS in the CARES Act.

He didn’t answer directly.

Instead, he ranted about raising postal rates — on YOU.

I know you want to stick it to Jeff Bezos by raising rates, @realDonaldTrump. But that will not save USPS. https://t.co/KaqMfkJqbI

The DC area is critical to the basic functioning of government. If health systems in our region are overwhelmed, we risk crippling our response to #COVID19 nationwide.

We just sent @SecAzar and @DHS_Wolf a list of actions that must be taken NOW to avoid that nightmare scenario. https://t.co/L8yaO4NDhH

This ruling is repugnant In the midst of a pandemic. The logic is tendentious at best and requires the reader to suspend the ugly reality of illness and death all around. Today the Supreme Court, motivated by partisan interest, has blood on its hands. 

https://t.co/6jql7IxoEl

Barack Obama has been out of office for 3 years. 

Donald Trump threw out the playbook Obama wrote, and fired the pandemic team he put in place. 

@RepBera and I warned him two years ago that he was grossly unprepared for this crisis. 

This is your failure, @realDonaldTrump. https://t.co/migNPggxZq https://t.co/MT6l2YvPy4

Former FED Chair Janet Yellen states that the actual unemployment rate is likely 13% and that the number of new claims this week will likely exceed last week’s 6.6 million, a record. She also believes GDP will contract by 30% but has seen models of 50%.

Capt. Crozier is one of the few patriots who bravely speak truth to power. 

He’s also one the thousands of Americans who is sick and out of a job as a direct result of this Administration’s cruel and incompetent response to #coronavirus.

We should all honor Capt. Crozier. https://t.co/DyYMljIfj5

Voting without an ID is not cheating, @realDonaldTrump. It’s just voting. 
 
But forcing someone who doesn’t have an ID to show you an ID in order to vote? That’s actual cheating. https://t.co/dW3YAEswxW

Donald Trump tramples the Constitution again. This time, late on a Friday night under the cover of global crisis. 

Congress may be at home, but we can see you, Mr. President. And we’re the one group of people you can’t fire. https://t.co/f63eJKgDeo

I hear the frustration of small business owners who are having trouble accessing the Paycheck Protection Program. Today I reached out to lenders and SBA and I made clear to them Congress meant for this to be easy. We need banks to lend money. We need to save small businesses.

If anyone believes we were too busy impeaching @realDonaldTrump to prepare for #coronavirus:

I told him he was gutting our ability to respond to a pandemic in May of 2018.

We weren’t impeaching you then, Mr. President. But we sure would be a lot better off now if we had. https://t.co/y9pkhqrXVe

These workers need wage and health care protections -- now. @GoIUPAT

Virginia has requested 2,214,388 #N95 masks from the federal government. As of Monday, we've received about 155,000.
 
That’s 7% of what we need. 
 
This is unacceptable, @realDonaldTrump. Virginians are DYING. Where is the #PPE?
Today’s unemployment numbers are staggering. And there will be more to come. Proud that Congress passed the CARES act to provide immediate assistance. But we must do more.

.@RepAOC and I are urging @OMBPress to extend the deadline for comment on a plan to radically change how the US measures poverty.

We need #PaycheckFairness. Now.

I’m on the Floor next to Mr Massie who insists on a recorded vote on the pandemic response legislation. Not a great idea with so much anxiety about putting folks at risk. But it is his right and we’ll deliver a powerful bipartisan vote to provide help to a suffering nation.

We are in the midst of the worst pandemic in 100 years and America is bleeding. 

This bill is not perfect. There is much I would add, and there are provisions I would certainly delete. But now is not the time to make the perfect the enemy of the good. We must pass the CARES Act. https://t.co/cYZlOON2vg

Reportedly, the GOP has nixed postal provisions from stimulus bill. 600,000 Postal Workers put themselves at risk of infection sorting and delivering medicine, ballots, food, and mail to every household and business in America. 

Now they face running out of cash by June.

Mr. President: your delusions aren’t a substitute for reality. We’re in the midst of a deadly pandemic here. 

And it’s growing. 

How about self-quarantining this Easter and letting the rest of us cope with a crisis?
Trump raising the expectation that we reopen by Easter: reckless, utterly irresponsible, will endanger lives.

Note to the public – this is not an essential service so stay home. Guns wont prevent COVID-19 but not practicing physical distancing could bring harm to you and your loved ones.
